title: Political Economy: Methods and Critique
description: Introduction to canonical texts in Marxism coupled with an examination of the questions of race, gender, ethnicity, and sexuality that distend the calculus of the canon's assumptive logic. May be taken after CLT&THY 200B.

title: Studies in Literary Theory and Its History
description: Introduction to criticism and aesthetics for beginning graduate students. Readings from continental, English, and American theorists.

title: Advanced Theory Seminar
description: Studies in selected areas of Criticism Topics addressed vary each quarter.
